clinical_study.brief_title: Exercise Training Associated With Inspiratory Muscle Training in Heart Failure
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Aerobic Exercise Training Associated With Inspiratory Muscle Training in Patients With Heart Failure

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Sao Paulo General Hospital

clinical_study.source: University of Sao Paulo General Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators hypothesize that aerobic exercise training associated with respiratory muscle training will cause additional benefits compared to isolated exercise training or respiratory training in chronic heart failure patients.

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators hypothesize that aerobic exercise training associated with respiratory muscle training will cause additional benefits in the autonomic control and respiratory function compared to isolated exercise training or respiratory training in chronic heart failure patients.

primary_outcome.description: Exercise training associated with inspiratory muscle training will reduce sympathetic nerve activity.

secondary_outcome.description: Exercise training associated with inspiratory muscle training will improve peak oxygen consumption
Exercise training associated with inspiratory muscle training will improve quality of life
Exercise training associated with inspiratory muscle training will reduces blood inflammatory markers
Exercise training associated with inspiratory muscle training will increase skeletal muscle strength
Exercise training associated with inspiratory muscle training will increase inspitarory muscle strength and endurance.

arm_group.description: Group undergoing isolate aerobic exercise training 3 times/week, during 40 minutes, for 04 mouths
Group undergoing isolate inspiratory muscle training 7 times/week, during 30 minutes, for 04 mouths
Group undergoing aerobic exercise training (3 times/week during 40 minutes) associate inspiratory muscle training (7 times/week during 30 minutes) for 04 mounths

intervention.description: The heart failure patients are subjected to differents protocols of physical training

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with systolic heart failure and New York Heart Association (NYHA) class II-III
- Left ventricular ejection fraction less than 40%
- Peak Oxygen Consumption less than 20 ml/Kg/min
Exclusion Criteria:
- Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease
- Neuromuscular, Orthopedic, Neurologic and Neoplastic Diseases
- Recent myocardial infarction or cardiac surgery (less than 6 months)
- Unstable angina pectoris
- Atrial Fibrillation
- Pacemakers users
- Actual Smoker
- Pregnant
- Changing medication or hospital admission
